key.description: The name of the changed property

enable.description: Switch for enabling input monitoring through HSP

syncMode.description: Specifies sync mode properties of video

videoStandard.description: Specifies video standard of the output

files.description: List all files with their full path inside the ZIP. Empty directories are not listed

lastUpdated.description: The time the test object is last uploaded

totalSize.description: Sum of uncompressed size of all files

enableVideoSlate.description: Enable run-time update on video slate (graphicFilename). default = false

graphicFilename.description: Filename of a graphic in the Asset Acquisition App to be used as the slate video

imageId.description: Id of an image in the system to be used as the slate image

trigger.description: Trigger of scte35 slate insertion mode.

lsmIds.description: List of LSM id that is controlling SONY_NMI input source

nmiIndex.description: NMI index associated with this input source

sources.description: Sources of the SDI over IP input

indices.description: Specify how to locate all audio tracks of the audio pid. The index order matters for mapping the channel position

pid.description: Pid of the audio stream that is used for selection

nielsenWatermarkConfig.description: List of NielsenWatermarkConfig for each Audio Profile

probingDurationInMs.description: Probing duration used for discovery in milliseconds

ccToDvbSubtitleConversion.description: Output data with cc to dvb subtitle conversion enabled

teletextToDvbSubtitleConversion.description: Output data with teletext to dvb subtitle conversion enabled

scte35SlateAddon.description: Configurations for SCTE35-triggered slates. If this object and all its compulsory fields are present, then SCTE-35 slate will be enabled.

dvbPageTimeout.description: Specifies the DVB PageTimeOut value (integer value in sec)

subtitleType.description: Output DVB subtitle descriptor type (default: e_NORMAL_0x10)

customKeyRotationTime.description: Custom key rotation start time in UTC, represented in format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ (e.g. 2021-03-04T12:34:56Z)

enable.description: Switch for turn on or off DRM

maxIndex.description: Settings of max index, the index is one-based.

minIndex.description: Settings of min index, the index is one-based.

desiredReplicas.description: Number of replicas to which the resource has to be scaled between the start and end of the cron schedule.

end.description: Cron expression indicating the end of the cron schedule.

start.description: Cron expression indicating the start of the cron schedule.

timezone.description: The acceptable values would be a value from the IANA Time Zone Database.

pmtDescriptorOutputMode.description:
PMT descriptor generation mode for hls ts segments

"e_LEGACY":Pass-through the last descriptor from the source, stream type id refer to "Stream Type Id Table",

"e_PASSTHROUGH":Pass-through all descriptors from the source, pass-through stream type id from source,

"e_DVB":Pass-through all descriptors from the source, override ATSC descriptor by generating DVB descriptor, stream type id refer to DVB scheme

Specific Customization for GPT set-top boxes, and later other similar cases

"e_NONE": no specific settings

"e_ProMedia": For Promedia-specific STBs (ID3 subtitles in Video segments, lower-case language code, "imagetype" in ID3 syntax)

name.description: The name of the variant channel filter. Must be unique. The number of filters is limited to 20000. Error code 500 will be returned if you try to add more.

trimAfterSCTE35Signal.description: Enable trimming segments AFTER a matching SCTE35 Signal.

trimAfterTime.description: Trimming segments AFTER this time. (in RFC3339 time format)

trimBeforeSCTE35Signal.description: Enable trimming segments BEFORE a matching SCTE35 Signal.

trimBeforeTime.description: Trimming segments BEFORE this time. (in RFC3339 time format)

edge.description: GPI Edge type, rising or falling, configured in GPI application

name.description: GPI Name, configured in GPI application

offset.description: GPI extra offset in milliseconds (range 0...20000) to trigger the event start

validateDpiPidIndex.description: Return error code 126 to alive/inject messages if DPI PID index is not used by any running service. Default is false (return 100).

channelName.description: Watermark label name to apply to the channel

sourceLabel.description: Source label in match-by-label mode (unused otherwise)

recvAddress.description: Receiving address of the zixi endpoint

recvPort.description: Receiving port of the zixi endpoint

dvrFilterByScte35.description: filter manifest DVR by scte35 signal. The resulting manifest is always bounded by dvrWindowSize if defined.

dvrWindowSize.description: filter manifest by DVR window size (in seconds).

enableAudioFilteringForPretranscodedCont.description: enable to allow audio codec and bitrate filtering with pre-transcode contents. default: false or null

enableDeltaUpdate.description: Enable delta update of manipulated manifests (support HLS only). Disabled by default.

id.description: id of the manifest filtering profile

minDvrInSecond.description: The minimum dvr window size manifest should contain (in second)

name.description: name of the manifest filtering profile

playlistSelection.description: compare local and alternative manifest and return the better one

preferredLanguage.description: Define the preferred language in three-letter language code

preferredVideoStreamIndex.description: Select video stream as default video, range from one to the length of video streams in original playlist

removeScte35Signals.description: Remove SCTE35 messages in output (support HLS only). Keep SCTE35 messages by default.

insertionSettings.description: Enable customized insertion settings for slate and set the sampling windows to 5-second for slate insertion.

insertionThreshold.description: A counter counts the number of 5-second windows with input errors (signal loss, video missing, scrambled PID). When this counter reaches insertionThreshold, the slate is inserted. Range [1,12]

resetThreshold.description: When the number of consecutive 5-second windows without error reaches resetThreshold, the counter of erroneous windows is reset. Range [1,12]

revertThreshold.description: A slate is removed when the number of consecutive 5-second windows without error reaches revertThreshold. Range [1,12]

ipAddress.description: IP address used to receive input. IPv4 and IPv6 are supported

ipPort.description: UDP port used to receive input

countryCode.description: Optional Country Code to append to the Language Code

dataTrackStreamType.description: Type of the data stream; Stream Type defined at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Program-specific_information#Elementary_stream_types

dpiPidIndex.description: This parameter enables out-of-band SCTE-104, and provides the associated dpi_pid_index. When out-of-band SCTE-104 is enabled, in-band input SCTE-35 messages are discarded

labels.description: Labels identifier of the data stream

ocrConversionBackgroundColor.description: Specifies DVB Subtitles background color for OCR conversion

skipProcessing.description: Indicate this data stream will not be processed and will not be mux.

dataTrackStreamType.description: Type of the data stream; Stream Type defined at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Program-specific_information#Elementary_stream_types

dvbTtmlData.description: Grooming settings for DVB TTML subtitle

skipProcessing.description: Indicate this data stream will not be processed and will not be mux.

streamName.description: Custom stream name to insert to HLS/DASH/CMAF manifest

drmControlState.description: Control state of DRM. DEFAULT means to follow existing DRM configuration. FORCE_UNENCRYPTED means to disable DRM for packaging (only support for CMAF packaging profile)

timeToProcessChangeInUtc.description: Time (in UTC) to enable/disable DRM, represented in format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ (e.g. 2021-03-04T12:34:56z)

matchSignal.description: Scte35 message match properties (asserts) for this trigger configuration

source.description: Input Source properties for this trigger configuration

srtConnectionInfo.description: Information about connection to cloud endpoint

maxNbTSSource.description: Maximum number of TS sources initialized at startup in the range [0..50]

maxNbTranscodeSource.description: Maximum number of statmux transcoding sources initialized at startup

maxNbTsSrtSource.description: Maximum number of SRT sources initialized at startup in the range [0..50]

numConsecutiveCycles.description: The number of consecutive sample periods with response latency exceeding threshold that will actually trigger a scale-up

responseLatencyThreshold.description: The threshold of the server response latency (Time to first response byte) to consider a scale-up

croppingSettings.description: Specifies the region of the video to crop

hasAmolLine.description: Specifies the removal of AMOL or WSS line from the source video

insertNullPidOnSignalLoss.description: Indicate insertion of nulls when there is video signal loss

labels.description: Labels identifier of the video stream

videoNoiseReduction.description: Specifies noise reduction and artifact repair option reqiured

status.description: The status of the output of the service

audFileId.description: Aud license file id (license with audience name/ID labels)

channelConfigs.description: List of KantarSnapWatermarkChannelConfig for each Audio Profile

licFileId.description: LIC license file id (license to unlock the product SDK)

g2oKey.description: Indicates the encryption format for the g2o authentication

g2oNonce.description: A simple string or number that tells the origin which key to use to authenticate the request

g2oTimeWindow.description: Allowable time difference (in second) for a request

g2oVersion.description: Indicates the encryption format for the g2o authentication

enableCmafKeyRotation.description: Enable or disable CMAF Key Rotation

enableDashKeyRotation.description: Enable or disable DASH Key Rotation

enableHlsKeyRotation.description: Enable or disable HLS Key Rotation

enableSsKeyRotation.description: Enable or disable SS Key Rotation

channelName.description: Channel name for the streaming channel

id.description: Id of the uplinkChannel

isPersistent.description: Whether to persistent the uplink channel for database store.

ipNetworkAddress.description: IP Network Address used to receive the stream

ipPortRangeEnd.description: End IP Port of IP Port Range to Scan

ipPortRangeStart.description: Start IP Port of IP Port Range to Scan

ipRangeEnd.description: End IP Address of IP Address Range to Scan

ipRangeStart.description: Start IP Address of IP Address Range to Scan

periodSeconds.description: The amount of time in seconds for which the rule should hold true

type.description: Allowed changed in terms of absolute number of pods or percentage of current replicas

value.description: No. of pods or percentage of existing replicas to scale down each time

halcenable.description: Output audio with Harmonic ALC enabled

kantarSnapWatermarkInsertionEnable.description: Output audio with Kantar Snap Watermark enabled

nielsenWatermarkInsertionEnable.description: Output audio with Nielsen Watermark enabled

id.description: Destination output id

refOutId.description: Id of corresponding Configure destination object

adaptationSetIdPattern.description: The pattern for generating the AdaptationSet ID in MPD document.The following patterns are supported:%mediaType - stream media type, %index - numbers in order

altWatermarkOutputPrefix.description: Alternative watermark output prefix, all the manifest and segments will be appended with this prefix.

audioSegmentLength.description: (Deprecrated) The duration of the audio segment files (expressed in seconds).

audioSegmentLengthInMillisecond.description: (Deprecrated) The duration of the audio segment files (expressed in milliseconds).

availabilityTimeOffset.description:
The availability time offset property (expressed in milliseconds) for DASH chunked CMAF low-latency mode.
Will be calculated automatically if -1 is set.

chunkDurationInMillisecond.description: The duration of the CMAF chunk in milliseconds.

closedCaptionHandling.description: The way to handle closed caption. Can be passthrough and/or converted to SMPTE-TT and/or converted to WebVTT. Empty list implies to ignore closed caption.

disableRawLines.description: Disable usage of Raw lines PSM and split lines algo for OCR

dvbSubtitleHandling.description: The way to handle DVB subtitle. Can be converted to SMPTE-TT and/or converted to WebVTT thanks to OCR and/or converted to SMPTE-TT text based thanks to OCR. Empty list implies to ignore DVB subtitle.

dvbTtmlHandling.description: The way to handle DVB TTML. Can be converted to SMPTE-TT. Empty list implies to ignore DVB TTML.

dvrWindowSize.description: Control of the availability of media segment files most recently added to the Media Presentation Description (MPD) file (expressed in seconds).

enableChunkedCMAF.description: Enable chunked CMAF for Dash to support low latency OTT delivery

enableCountryCode.description: Use ISO Country Code in language identification

enableEarlyAvailablePeriod.description: Specify is Early Available Periods enabled, if so, in low latency mode scte35 will be inserted into manifest as Early Available Period

enableOttWatermark.description: (Deprecated) Enable OTT watermarking. When this parameter is true, two set of AB outputs will be generated with only filename difference.

enablePackageBasedKeyRotation.description: Override the DRM global setting and enable customized per Package output key rotation setting

encryptionMethod.description: Specify which encryption method should be used when integrate with DRM.

firstCodecGroupInManifest.description: First codec group that appears in the manifest

hideLatestSegment.description: Hide latest segment in SegmentationTimeline. Possibly needed if watermarking is enabled

imageSpriteInColumn.description: Static POTF thumbnail per column in one tile

imageSpriteInRow.description: Static POTF thumbnail per row in one tile

insertAdaptationSetId.description: Include the Id attribute to the AdaptionSet element in MPD document

insertAudioChannelConfiguration.description: Include the AudioChannelConfiguration tag to the AAC Adaption Set.

insertAudioRole.description: Include the AudioRole tag to the audio Adaption Set. Used only if mediaPresentationProfile is e_ISO_LIVE

insertContentType.description: Include the ContentType attribute to the AdaptionSet element in MPD document

insertDefaultKIDToManifest.description: Insert default Key ID to manifest. Default value is false.

insertLabelElement.description: Insert Label element to Adaptation Set in DASH manifest.

insertParAndSarAttributesInMpd.description: Include AdaptationSet@par and Representation@sar attributes in DASH manifest.

keyChangePeriod.description: The key change period for key rotation (expressed in seconds).

keyRotationSignalling.description:
Configuration of key rotation signalling:
 - MANIFEST_BASED_SINGLE_PERIOD (Manifest-based, Single Period) 
- IN_BAND (Segment-based, Single Period)
Default: MANIFEST_BASED_SINGLE_PERIOD

latencyMax.description: Service Description: the service providers indication about the maximum presentation latency in milliseconds.

latencyMin.description: Service Description:: the service providers indication about the minimum presentation latency in milliseconds.

latencyTarget.description: Service Description: the service providers preferred presentation latency in milliseconds compared to the producer reference time.

maxSegmentDurationSignaling.description: Include the MaxSegmentDuration tag to the Media Presentation Description (MPD) file. Used only if segmentTemplateType is e_TIME_BASED

mediaPresentationProfile.description:
The profile used for generating Media Presentation Description (MPD) file that enables interoperability and signaling use of features in a Media Presentation.

The following types are supported:
ISO Live: refers to the ISO/IEC 23009-1, 8.4 ISO Base media file format live profile.
HbbTV ISO BMFF Live: refers to HbbTV ISOBMFF defined in HbbTV 1.5 specification.
DVB DASH Live: refers to ETSI TS 103 285 (MPEG-DASH Profile for Transport of ISO BMFF Based DVB Services over IP Based Networks) specification

minBufferTimeInMs.description: The minimum buffer time of dash manifest.

minimumUpdatePeriod.description: The minimum update period of dash manifest.

mpdAccessibilityComplianceMode.description: Change the Accessibility tag compliance in the Media Presentation Description (MPD). Used to switch to DASH-IF compliance mode

mpdFileName.description: The name of Media Presentation Description (MPD) file which is used to describe a Media Presentation.

parentalControlSignaling.description: Specify which parental control signal should be used.

passThroughParameterSets.description: Pass-through Parameter Sets. When this parameter is true, the video parameter sets store in the sample entry and the samples, and the sample entry name is 'hev1' for HEVC or 'avc3' for AVC. Otherwise, the video parameter sets store only in the sample entry, and the sample entry name is 'hvc1' for HEVC or 'avc1' for AVC.

playbackRateMax.description: Service Description:: the maximum playback rate that the content provider indicates is appropriate for the purposes of automatically adjusting playback latency and buffer occupancy during normal playback, where 1.0 is normal playback speed.

playbackRateMin.description: Service Description:: the minimum playback rate that the content provider indicates is appropriate for the purposes of automatically adjusting playback latency and buffer occupancy during normal playback, where 1.0 is normal playback speed.

relativePathSegmentTemplate.description: Relative or absolute path in segment template

representationIdPattern.description:
The pattern for generating the Representation ID which is used in the Media Presentation Description (MPD) for each encoded version of video/audio.

The following patterns are supported:
%starttimeitem4The start time of the Publishing session
%streamIditem4Stream ID
%PIDitem4PID
%bitrate - bitrate of the representation

scte27SubtitleHandling.description: The way to handle SCTE-27 subtitles. Can be converted to SMPTE-TT. Empty list implies to ignore SCTE-27 subtitle.

scte35CIDPassthrough.description: Enable SCTE35 ContentID Handling. When this parameter is true, the Content ID signal will be pass-through by inserting a event message with base64 string on the manifest.

scte35CreateNewPeriodForNbcOverlayPlacem.description: Creation of a new period for Overlay Placement SCTE-35 messages in NBC mode.

scte35DefaultAutoReturnDuration.description: SCTE-35 Default Auto-return Duration, for HARMONIC handling mode only.

scte35Signaling.description: The way of handling SCTE35 messages. 'NONE' means ignoring the messages; 'BASE64' means writing the SCTE35 data to playlist in base64 format; 'HARMONIC' means writing the SCTE35 data to playlist in Harmonic Inc defined SCTE35 format. Default is 'NONE'

segmentLengthInMillisecond.description: The duration of the media segment files (expressed in milliseconds).

segmentRetentionPeriod.description: The duration that the media segment files actually retain in the publishing server (expressed in minutes).

segmentTemplateType.description: The type of segment template for constructing segment URL. 'TIME_BASED' means time-based segment template; 'NUMBER_BASED' means number-based segment template. Default is 'TIME_BASED'

serviceDescription.description: Add Service Description in manifest. It allows to sync all the players (supporting low-latency) to a similar latency, based on the PRFT value.

suggestedPresentationDelayMillisecond.description:
The suggested presentation delay is to let the player to play behind the live point (expressed in milliseconds) to encounter buffer issues.
Optimal value will be used if -1 is set.
Default value is -1.

teletextHandling.description: The way to handle teletext. Can be converted to WebVTT and/or converted to SMPTE-TT. Empty list implies to ignore DVB subtitle.

ttmlTemplate.description: The TTML template. String in XML that allows to control how output TTML looks like.

useAbsoluteTimestamps.description: Property to control the availability start time. Default value is false.

usePtsAsPto.description: Use PTS as PTO in DASH manifest

utcTimingSchemeIdUri.description: UTCTiming element SchemeIdUri, this element will be added in Dash manifest to help synchronize Dash client with the server

utcTimingValue.description: UTCTiming element Value, available if UtcTimingSchemeIdUri is not 'None'

videoSegmentLength.description: (Deprecrated) The duration of the video segment files (expressed in seconds).

videoSegmentLengthInMillisecond.description: (Deprecrated) The duration of the video segment files (expressed in milliseconds).

adapter.description: Adapter, corresponds to tuner Ids (adapter 0 is tuner 1)

pmtStreamType.description: Num value of dataStreamtype from PMT

type.description: Specify type of SourceFailoverCondition required to support. Note: PID_MISSING may be set to detect a video missing PID or a video decoding issue

assetId.description: File name for the graphic to be played, the filename extension is optional

assetTitle.description: Text or additional information about the graphic, usually the material title

audioProfileName.description: Name of the grooming profile to be used, allows the audio tracks of a .wav file to be selected. Grooming profiles are defined in the Asset Acquisition application

description.description: Descriptive text that may contain additional information about the event

duration.description: Length of the event (hh:mm:ss.sss), only used when the end mode is Duration

endMode.description: Determines how the end timing for the secondary event will be calculated. DURATION secondary event will end at the secondary start time + duration, OFFSETFROMEND secondary will end at an offset from the end time of the primary event, NOEND secondary will be terminated by a future secondary event on the same layer

endOffset.description: End offset, ([+-]hh:mm:ss.sss), only used when the end mode is OffsetFromEnd. Can be positive or negative, blank or empty is interpreted as zero offset

layer.description: Layer used for the logo/graphics, 1 to 8. If missing, the value 1 is used. When graphics overlap, the graphic on the higher layer has priority

startMode.description: Indicates how the start timing for the secondary event will be calculated, offset from the start or end of the primary event

startOffset.description: Start offset ([+-]hh:mm:ss.sss), only used when the start mode is OffsetFromStart. Can be positive or negative, blank or empty is interpreted as zero offset

stopAnimationLeadTime.description: Duration of the graphic's outro sequence (hh:mm:ss.sss), applies to 3-point animation graphics. The outro will be started this time before the secondary event ends

tcDuration.description: Equivalent to duration, but in timecode format (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcEndOffset.description: Equivalent to endOffset, but in timecode format ([+-]hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcStartOffset.description: Equivalent to startOffset, but in timecode format ([+-]hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcStopAnimationLeadTime.description: Equivalent to stopAnimationLeadTime, but in timecode format (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

templateFields.description: Additional information that can be passed to HTML graphic templates

zixiEndPointSetting.description: Zixi End point setting. Only required to fill in end point Id. RecvAddress and recvPort are generated Internally

assetId.description: Identifier for the asset to be played; a live source name, filename for file assets (the uri of the asset in asset library, with or without file path and extension), or asset title for recorded assets

assetTitle.description: Text or additional information about the asset, usually the material title

audioProfileName.description: The grooming profile to be used for file assets, to allow the audio tracks of the file to be selected. Grooming profiles are defined in the Asset Acquisition application. Not applicable to live events and recorded assets

description.description: Descriptive text that may contain additional information about the event

endMode.description: Specifies how the event will end (Duration or Manual)

materialType.description: Material type of the asset. Special values Program, Avail, and Commercial are used for SCTE-35 generation

scte35WindowEnd.description: End time of the SCTE-35 validity window (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ), in UTC. This event and following events in the same ad pod (material type is COMMERCIAL or AVAIL, and start mode is FOLLOW) are skipped if we don't receive SCTE-35 trigger with splice-time before this time, or if we don't receive SCTE-35 trigger x seconds before this time (x is 2 seconds if the event after the ad-pod is a prepared live source, otherwise it can be up to 32 seconds). Used only when the startMode is EXTERNAL

scte35WindowStart.description: Start time of the SCTE-35 validity window (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ), in UTC. Any SCTE-35 trigger with a splice-time before this time is ignored. Used only when the startMode is EXTERNAL

som.description: Indicates the position in the asset to start playback (hh:mm:ss.sss). When the SomType is RELATIVE, the SOM value is the offset from the start of asset. When the SomType is ABSOLUTE, it is the timecode value for the starting position in the asset. An empty or blank value is treated as zero offset

somType.description: The type of SOM, which determines how the SOM value is used. When the SomType is RELATIVE, the SOM value is the offset from the start of asset. When the SomType is ABSOLUTE, the Som value is the timecode value for the starting position in the asset

startMode.description: Specifies how the event will start (Fixed Time, Follow, Manual Take, or External SCTE-35 trigger)

startTime.description: Event start date/time in UTC (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ). The start time will be automatically calculated for all events except those with Fixed start mode

tcDuration.description: Equivalent to duration, but in timecode format (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcErrorDuration.description: Equivalent to errorDuration, but in timecode format (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcScte35WindowEnd.description: Equivalent to scte35WindowEnd, but in timecode format (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcScte35WindowStart.description: Equivalent to scte35WindowStart, but in timecode format (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcSom.description: Equivalent to som, but in timecode format (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcStartTime.description: Equivalent to startTime, but in timecode format (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

upid.description: The uPid value is inserted in the segmentation_upid field of the segmentation descriptor in generated SCTE-35 messages. SCTE-35 messages are generated for events with material type PROGRAM, AVAIL, or COMMERCIAL. It is a hexadecimal string, e.g. "0x000000002C11422B" with or without the leading "0x"

upidType.description: The uPid type is inserted in the segmentation_upid_type field of the segmentation descriptor in generated SCTE-35 messages. SCTE-35 messages are generated for events with material type PROGRAM, AVAIL, or COMMERCIAL

When the SomType is ABSOLUTE, it is the timecode value for the starting position in the asset. An empty or blank value is treated as zero offset

startTime.description: Event start date/time in UTC (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ). The start time will be automatically calculated for all events except those with Fixed start mode

DURATION secondary event will end at the secondary start time + duration, OFFSETFROMEND secondary will end at an offset from the end time of the primary event, NOEND secondary will be terminated by a future secondary event on the same layer

endOffset.description: End offset, ([+-]hh:mm:ss.sss), only used when the end mode is OffsetFromEnd. Can be positive or negative, blank or empty is interpreted as zero offset

layer.description: Layer used for the logo/graphics, 1 to 8. If missing, the value 1 is used. When graphics overlap, the graphic on the higher layer has priority

Support range defined in Annex A of ETSI EN 300 468 V1.16.1 (e.g. 0x14 for Traditional Chinese). If not defined, the default coding table as defined in the annex would be used.

outputPmtPid.description: Output PMT PID, normal range is 32..8190. If -1 is set, source grooming value (as set during discover process) will be used, or 32 if not defined in source grooming (non-TS source for example). If -2 is set, the value is initialized at service start with input PMT PID, or 32 for non-TS source (-2 is available for backward compatibility and is not recommended). Any other value is not recommended and will behave as -1 in current version.

aribAspectRatioConversionMode.description:
This feature implements proprietary handling of 1080i to 480i scaling.
When aribAspectRatioConversionMode is set to e_ANAMORPHIC, video mode change follows the ARIB B.32 spec.
When aribAspectRatioConversionMode is set to e_PRESERVER_ASPECT_RATIO, VAR is always set to 4x3, regardless of input.
When input VRAR is 0(4x3), a center-cut operation is performed; when VRAR is 1 (16x9), a letterbox transformation is performed.
When aribAspectRatioConversionMode is set to e_FORCE_PROPRIETARY_LETTERBOX_MODE, output VAR and DRAR are set to 4x3,
regardless of input, and a letterbox transformation is performed.

When  any audio/data stream becomes unavailable, device need to adjust the video bitrate by adding the unused bandwidth which was allocated by the audio/data stream.

%streamid:streamIdFormat=%0{number}llu Stream ID in some format, for example %01llu. %02llu is the default.

Sample configuration: %streamid-iframe
Resultant file name: 01-iframe.m3u8
Sample configuration: %streamid:streamIdFormat=%01llu-iframe
Resultant file name: 1-iframe.m3u8

absoluteMediaPlaylistFileName.description:
Absolute media playlist filename. Value is a suffix to relative media playlist filename if absoluteMediaPlaylistFileNameAsSuffix is true. Otherwise, the value is the absolute media playlist filename pattern, which is supported as listed below.

Supported escape pattern:
%streamid Stream ID
%streamid:streamIdFormat=%0{number}llu Stream ID in some format, for example %01llu. %02llu is the default.

Sample configuration: %streamid
Resultant file name: 01.m3u8
Sample configuration: %streamid:streamIdFormat=%01llu
Resultant file name: 1.m3u8

absoluteMediaPlaylistFileNameAsSuffix.description: Indicate whether absolute media playlist filename is specified as suffix or pattern

altWatermarkOutputPrefix.description: Alternative watermark output prefix, all the playlists and segments will be appended with this prefix.

attributeCustomizationProfileId.description: Specify the Variant Customization Profile to tune the HLS playlist attributes.

bandwidthBasedOnEsBitrate.description: To base the BANDWIDTH attribute on ES bitrate instead of TS bitrate in variant playlist

chunkDurationInMillisecond.description: The duration of the CMAF chunk in milliseconds

closedCaptionHandling.description: The way to handle Closed Caption. Can be passthrough and/or converted to WebVTT, and/or converted to IMSC1. Empty list implies to ignore closed caption

customGroupingProfileId.description: Specify the HLS Audio Grouping Profile to customize the HLS playlist audio and video grouping.

decodeTimeShiftToPlayTime.description: Enable to shift decoding timeline to match the presentation timeline, resulting in same first DTS and PTS for each segment, as well as potential negative CTO in segment. Take effect only on fMP4 package output

disableRawLines.description: Disable usage of Raw lines PSM and split lines algo for OCR

displayHResolutionRounding.description: The function that will be used to round the display horizontal resolution.

displayHdcpLevelAttribute.description: Specify whether to show HDCP-LEVEL attribute for each stream on HLS master playlist.

dropSgpdBox.description: Drop sgpd and sbgp box in fMP4

dvbSubtitleHandling.description: The way to handle DVB subtitle. Can be passthrough and/or converted to SMPTE-TT (in ID3), and/or converted to Webvtt thanks to OCR. Empty list implies to ignore DVB subtitle

dvbTtmlHandling.description: The way to handle DVB TTML. Can be converted to WebVTT. Empty list implies to ignore DVB TTML

dvrWindowSize.description: Control the availability of media segment files most recently added to the index file (in seconds).

enableAbsoluteSegmentURL.description: Enable absolute URL in media playlist to reference stream playlist

enableAbsoluteURL.description: Enable absolute URL in master playlist to reference stream playlist

enableAverageBandwidthAttribute.description: Enable AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH attribute in variant playlist

enableChunkedCMAF.description: Enable chunked CMAF to support low latency OTT delivery

enableCodecsAttributeInVariantPlaylist.description: Whether to specify CODECS attribute in EXT-X-STREAM-INF in variant playlist

enableContentSteeringPlaylist.description: Enable the content steering master playlist to check cluster status and steer the content to the available cluster.

enableCountryCode.description: Use ISO Country Code in language identification

enableExtXGapTag.description: Enable the insertion of a GAP tag in the playlist during periods of content loss. This helps indicate missing content segments in the HLS stream.

enableLegacySpliceInsertHandle.description: Enable handle splice insert with no segmentation descriptor in STANDARD mode. Default is false

enableOttWatermark.description: (Deprecated) Enable OTT watermarking. When this parameter is true, two set of AB outputs will be generated with only filename difference.

enablePackageBasedKeyRotation.description: Override the DRM global setting and enable customized per Package output key rotation setting

enablePlaylistTypeEventTag.description: Enable inserion of "EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE:EVENT" tag in Start-over mode

enableSubFolderMode.description: Use sub-folder mode for HLS in WebDav Mode

encryptSEI.description: Enable SEI encryption for HLS fmp4 package output, if value is false, encryption of SEI entry will be skipped

fakeSegmentationType.description: Which segmentation type to use for fake segmentation when enableLegacySpliceInsertHandle is true. Default is 54 (0x36 Distributor Placement Opportunity Start)

firstSegmentProgramDateTime.description: When this parameter is true, only the first segment has EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag. Otherwise, program data time tags are set for every segment.

floatingPointDurationInPlaylist.description: The EXTINF tag value will be presented in floating point.

hlsEncryptionMethod.description: Specify which encryption method should be used when integrate with DRM.

iframeCodec.description: The codec used for I-frame only segment

iframeDiscreteSegmentInterval.description: The interval to generate discrete I-frame based on the IDR for VOD I-frame only playlist

iframeEnableInitSection.description: Enable to add EXT-X-MAP in I-frame only playlist. Value only takes effect for package in TS

iframeMjpegSegmentInterval.description: The interval to generate thumbnails based on the IDR for I-frame only playlist for MJPEG codecs.

iframeSegmentHandling.description: The method to record the IDR for I-frame only playlist.

indexFileNameForIFrameOnlyStreamForFlatt.description:
An index file is an ordered list of media URLs and informational tags. Each media URL refers to a media file which is a segment of a I-Frame Only stream. This setting specifies the file name of the index file for each variant stream excluding file extension (i.e. .m3u8).

Supported escape pattern:
%streamid Stream ID

Sample configuration: %streamid
Resultant file name: 01.m3u8

indexFileNameForMediaStreamForFlattenedM.description:
An index file is an ordered list of media URLs and informational tags. Each media URL refers to a media file which is a segment of a single contiguous stream. This setting specifies the file name of the index file for each variant stream excluding file extension (i.e. .m3u8).

Supported escape pattern:
%streamid Stream ID
%streamid:streamIdFormat=%0{number}llu Stream ID in some format, for example %01llu. %02llu is the default.

Sample configuration: %streamid
Resultant file name: 01.m3u8
Sample configuration: %streamid:streamIdFormat=%01llu
Resultant file name: 1.m3u8

insertAudioChannels.description: Specify whether the CHANNEL value must be inserted in master playlist for each audio track.

insertCustomStreamName.description: Insert custom name to NAME attribute of EXT-X-MEDIA tag in HLS manifest.

insertPlaylistCustomTag.description: Insert custom tag in Master playlist header

isoLanguageCode.description: Define ISO language code to use for audio and subtitles.

keepOverlayPlcmtOppInClear.description: Keep Overlay Placement Opportunity in Clear

keyChangePeriod.description: The key change period for key rotation (expressed in seconds).

lateBindingAudio.description: Enable late binding audio at manifest. If set to Both, two variant playlists will be generated.

noExtXKeyTagForUnencryptedStreams.description: No EXT-X-KEY tag for unencrypted streams

partHoldBackInMs.description: Set the part hold back duration in low-latency HLS playlist (in milliseconds). -1 means 3 x part target duration

partTargetDurationInMs.description: Set the part target duration in low-latency HLS playlist (in milliseconds). 0 means auto

passThroughParameterSets.description: Pass-through Parameter Sets. When this parameter is true, the video parameter sets store in the sample entry and the samples, and the sample entry name is 'hev1' for HEVC or 'avc3' for AVC. Otherwise, the video parameter sets store only in the sample entry, and the sample entry name is 'hvc1' for HEVC or 'avc1' for AVC.

playlistCustomTag.description: Insert custom string tag in HLS manifest.

richSegmentUriInfo.description: Rich Segment URI Info option provides an alternative playlist generation method which is easier for publishing destinations to parse the playlists.

scte27SubtitleHandling.description: The way to handle SCTE-27 subtitles. Can be converted to SMPTE-TT. Empty list implies to ignore SCTE-27 subtitle.

scte35AnnotationTag.description: Control the tag for annotating SCTE35 message on HLS playlist

scte35CIDPassthrough.description: Enable SCTE35 ContentID Handling. When this parameter is true, the Content ID signal will be pass-through by inserting a event message with base64 string on the manifest.

scte35DaterangeTagsInMs.description: Use milliseconds for SCTE-35 EXT-X-DATERANGE tag

scte35DefaultAutoReturnDuration.description: SCTE-35 Default Auto-return Duration, for signaling mode e_STANDARD, e_GOOGLE_DOUBLE_CLICK, e_UK_1, e_NBC and e_HULU only.

scte35GoogleHlsVodAnnotationType.description: The way of handling Google Double Click VOD SCTE35 messages. 'NONE' means ignoring the messages; 'e_placementOpportunity' means when a SCTE-35 message provider placement opportunity start with duration=0 is received, the PTS in this message will be used to start a new segment and the #EXT-X-PLACEMENT-OPPORTUNITY tag, will be inserted in the manifest for this segment.

scte35RetainProgramChapterStart.description: Retain program/chapter start SCTE-35 messages in NBC mode

scte35Signaling.description: The way of handling SCTE35 messages. 'NONE' means ignoring the messages; 'BASE64' means writing the SCTE35 data to playlist in base64 format.; 'STANDARD' means writing the SCTE35 data to playlist in SCTE35 Standard format; 'GOOGLE DOUBLE CLICK' means writing the SCTE35 data to playlist in Google Double Click format; 'UK 1' means writing the SCTE35 data to playlist in UK 1 format; 'NBC' means writing the SCTE35 data to playlist in NBC annotation; 'HULU' means writing the SCTE35 data to playlist in Hulu annotation; Default is 'NONE'

segmentFileNamePrefixForFlattenedMode.description:
The file name prefix of the media segment files.

Supported escape pattern:
%starttime Publishing session start time
%sequence Media segment sequence number
%streamid Stream ID
%time - Segment start time

Sample configuration: %starttime-%streamid-%sequence
Resultant file name: 20120108T035411-01-13949.ts

segmentLength.description: (Deprecated) The duration of the media segment files (in seconds).

segmentLengthInMillisecond.description: The duration of the media segment files (in milliseconds).

segmentRetentionPeriod.description: The duration that the media segment files actually retain in the publishing server (in minutes).

startingLivePoint.description: Starting live point in seconds. A positive number indicates a time offset from the beginning of the Playlist. A negative number indicates a negative time offset from the end of the last Media Segment in the Playlist.

subtitleNamePattern.description:
The subtitle name pattern.

Supported escape pattern:
%LANG Subtitle language code in uppercase
%lang Subtitle language code in uppercase
%index Subtitle track index

Sample configuration: Sub%lang or Sub%LANG or Sub%index or Sub%LANG%index (for language: ita)
Resultant subtitle name: Subita or SubITA or Sub1 or SubITA1

targetDuration.description: Set the target duration in playlist (in seconds). 0 means follow segment duration

teletextHandling.description: (Deprecated) The way to handle teletext. Can be converted to WebVTT or passthrough

teletextHandlingList.description: The way to handle teletext. Can be passthrough and/or converted to WebVTT, and/or converted to IMSC1

ttmlTemplate.description: The TTML template. String in XML that allows to control how output TTML looks like

urlOrderOfVariantPlaylist.description: Specify how the playlist URLs are arranged in the variant playlist.

variantPlaylistFileName.description: The variant playlist lists the URLs of each variant stream to allow clients to switch between encodings dynamically. This setting specifies the file name of the variant playlist excluding file extension (i.e. .m3u8). For example, if this value is set to 'master' (excluding ''), the actual file name will be 'master.m3u8'.

endTime.description: Live Event end time in UTC

prerollDuration.description: Live Event preroll duration in seconds

startTime.description: Live Event start time in UTC

withAudioGain.description: Filtering audios with gain applied at the transcoding stage and audios without

id.description: Unique identifier of the key pair

mode.description: Identifies how is generated the key pair. The possible values are: INJECTED_KEY (injected by user) or BURIED_KEY (buried at factory).

hdrSignaling.description: HDR Signaling, work with HEVC codec and H265 Main10 encoding Profile

profileIndex.description: When not null, profides ordering among output profiles, with value starting from 1. When null, order in the JSON is used.

vbvDelay.description: (Deprecrated) Video buffering verifier buffer time in miliseconds, and value under 10 represents time in seconds

When the SomType is ABSOLUTE, it is the timecode value for the starting position in the asset. An empty or blank value is treated as zero offset

SCTE-35 messages are generated for events with material type PROGRAM, AVAIL, or COMMERCIAL. It is a hexadecimal string, e.g. "0x000000002C11422B" with or without the leading "0x"

upidType.description: The uPid type is inserted in the segmentation_upid_type field of the segmentation descriptor in generated SCTE-35 messages. SCTE-35 messages are generated for events with material type PROGRAM, AVAIL, or COMMERCIAL

dpiProcessingMode.description:
['e_PASS_THROUGH','e_REGENERATION' ,'e_ENCODING_ONLY' ] dpiProcessingMode='e_PASS_THROUGH' for transcode with SCTE35
		dpiProcessingMode='e_ENCODING_ONLY' is necesary for SCTE104 (deprecated, use dpiProcessingOption instead)

dpiProcessingOption.description: ['e_IB_PASSTHROUGH_ONLY', 'e_OOB_ESAM_ONLY', 'e_IB_ESAM_OOB_ESAM', 'e_IB_PASSTHROUGH_OOB_ESAM','e_DSMCC'] Determine the behavior of in-band (IB) and out-of-band (OOB) ESAM, or set to DSMCC stream

dpiSource.description: ['e_IP', 'e_ESAM', 'e_UMP_AS', ' e_VANC' , 'e_DTMF', 'e_ESAM_AND_UMP_AS'] dpiSource ='e_VANC' is necesary for SCTE104 over SDI (deprecated, use dpiProcessingOption instead)

dpiStbMode.description: e_PROPRIETARY_MODE_1 enables proprietary tier and time-signal keep-alive handling, e_PROPRIETARY_MODE_2 enables pre-roll extended to 30 seconds for SCTE-104 commands

dpiTimeOffset.description: parameter in milliseconds to adjust Splice timing in the video stream. Default is 0ms.

enableSpliceAutoReturn.description: generate automatic splice-in message for SCTE 104 splice insert command. Default is true.

enableSpliceInsertRepetition.description: Controls splice_insert() messages repetition every second during the 5s preroll period. Default is true.

enableSpliceNull.description: generates splice_null() SCTE35 messages in this DPI component

enableTimeDescriptor.description: Enable time_descriptor() optional extension to the splice_insert(), splice_null() and time_signal() commands that allows a programmer's wall clock time to be sent to a client

insertIDR.description: controls IDR insert for this DPI component. Default is true.

scte104PrerollMode.description: Minimum pre-roll required for this DPI component. Default is e_4_SEC. e_0_SEC/e_1_SEC allows support of low pre-roll component at the expense of longer video latency. Applicable use cases include baseband inputs (SCTE-104), TS inputs (SCTE-35 and SCTE-104 over ST-2038), and out-of-band inputs (SCTE-104, ESAM).

timeDescriptorOffset.description: paratemer required to adjust programmer's wall clock time to be sent to a client with time_descriptor() optionnal mesages

fontDensity.description:
Horizontal font density, range: 0.5-2.5. A value of 1.0 equals 1em of the font. 2.0 will map 2em into the one cell.
For fixed sized fonts a value of 1 is recommended, but for true type a value of 1.7 looks much better.

minBitrate.description:
Minimum bitrate in kbps.
A DVB subtitle keep-alive packet is a minimal PES packet made of 3 bytes:
   0x20: data_identifier for DVB subtitles
   0x00: subtitle_stream_id
   0xFF: end_of_PES_data_field_marker

Default is CAPT

scte35Signaling.description: The way of handling SCTE35 messages. 'NONE' means ignoring the messages; 'AZURE' means writing SCTE35 data to sparse text track according to Azure ingest format specification, 'USP' means writing SCTE35 data to sparse track according to Unified Streaming ingest format specification. Default is 'NONE'

segmentRetentionPeriod.description: The duration that the media segment files actually retain in the publishing server (expressed in minutes).

showReadySegmentsOnly.description: Wait for all bitrates to be ready and skip to add chunk into manifest for those not ready segments. Default is true.

subtitleFourCC.description: Define FourCC for subtitle. This field should be s string containing 4 characters.

subtitleNamePattern.description:
The subtitle name pattern.

Supported escape pattern:
%lang Subtitle language code in lowercase
%index Subtitle track index

Sample configuration: sub_%lang or sub_%index or sub_%lang_%index (for language: ita)
Resultant subtitle name: sub_ita or sub_1 or sub_ita_1

ttmlTemplate.description: The TTML template. String in XML that allows to control how output TTML looks like.

useRepeatAttribute.description: A boolean option of using repeat attribute in manifest generation to represent segment entries with same duration in continuous series. Default is true.

videoSegmentLength.description: The duration of the video segment files (expressed in seconds).

videoSegmentLengthInMillisecond.description: The duration of the video segment files (expressed in milliseconds).

connectionType.description: Type of connection to ATSC PMCP table provider. FTP mode accepts only FTP connection and FTPS_EXPLICIT mode accepts only FTPS connection in explicit mode. (default value is FTP)

ftpUrl.description: Url of ATSC PMCP table provider

id.description: Unique identifier of a table generator in UUID format

login.description: Login to ATSC PMCP table provider

name.description: Display name of a table generator

password.description: Password to ATSC PMCP table provider

assetId.description: Identifier for the asset to be played; a live source name, filename for file assets (the uri of the asset in asset library, with or without file path and extension), or asset title for recorded assets

assetStatus.description: Indicates that the asset or live source is ready to play, or if there is a problem

assetStatusReason.description: Description of why the asset is not valid or not compatible

assetTitle.description: Text or additional information about the asset, usually the material title

audioProfileName.description: The grooming profile to be used for file assets, to allow the audio tracks of the file to be selected. Grooming profiles are defined in the Asset Acquisition application. Not applicable to live events and recorded assets

description.description: Descriptive text that may contain additional information about the event

durationError.description: True if the play offset (when relative or absolute SOM is used) + duration is greater than the asset duration, not included if false

endMode.description: Specifies how the event will end (Duration or Manual)

errorDuration.description: Indicates the duration of the gap or overlap error (hh:mm:ss.sss). Only present if an overlap or gap error is detected

eventTooShort.description: True if the event duration is less than the minimum allowed (1 sec)

eventType.description: Event type, File (including recorded file) or Live

firstTimecodeInAsset.description: First timecode value for the asset, if available (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff). Only present when using absolute (timecode) SOM and somError = true

formatDescription.description: Describes the framerate and resolution of the live source used in the event, only present when invalidFormat = true

gapError.description: True if there is a time gap between this event and the preceding event

groupId.description: Group id (UUID), identifies the group of events that make up a looping schedule. All events of the looping schedule have the same group id

id.description: Event id (UUID)

invalidFormat.description: True if the framerate or resolution of the live source referenced by the event isn't compatible with the channel's framerate or resolution

lastTimecodeInAsset.description: Last timecode value for the asset + 1 (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff). Only present when using absolute (timecode) SOM, if the first timecode is available and somError = true

loopNumber.description: Loop number, starting at 1, if the event belongs to a looping schedule

materialType.description: Material type of the asset. Special values Program, Avail, and Commercial are used for SCTE-35 generation

missingAssetDuration.description: Indicates missing duration for the asset to fit the configured SOM and duration (hh:mm:ss.sss). Only present if a duration error is detected

origin.description: Origin (creator) of the event. Events can be created by the operator or traffic/scheduling system

overlapError.description: True if start time of this event is before the end time of the preceding event

scte35WindowEnd.description: End time of the SCTE-35 validity window (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ), in UTC. This event and following events in the same ad pod (material type is COMMERCIAL or AVAIL, and start mode is FOLLOW) are skipped if we don't receive SCTE-35 trigger with splice-time before this time, or if we don't receive SCTE-35 trigger x seconds before this time (x is 2 seconds if the event after the ad-pod is a prepared live source, otherwise it can be up to 32 seconds). Used only when the startMode is EXTERNAL

scte35WindowStart.description: Start time of the SCTE-35 validity window (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ), in UTC. Any SCTE-35 trigger with a splice-time before this time is ignored. Used only when the startMode is EXTERNAL

som.description: Indicates the position in the asset to start playback (hh:mm:ss.sss). When the SomType is RELATIVE, the SOM value is the offset from the start of asset. When the SomType is ABSOLUTE, it is the timecode value for the starting position in the asset. An empty or blank value is treated as zero offset

somError.description: True to indicate the event's SOM Type (ABSOLUTE or RELATIVE) and SOM value specify a starting position that is past the end of the asset

somType.description: The type of SOM, which determines how the SOM value is used. When the SomType is RELATIVE, the SOM value is the offset from the start of asset. When the SomType is ABSOLUTE, the Som value is the timecode value for the starting position in the asset

startMode.description: Specifies how the event will start (Fixed Time, Follow, Manual Take, or External SCTE-35 trigger)

startTime.description: Event start date/time in UTC (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ). The start time will be automatically calculated for all events except those with Fixed start mode

state.description: Event execution state. IDLE for future events, ONAIR, or DONE for past events

tcDuration.description: Equivalent to duration, but in timecode format (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcErrorDuration.description: Equivalent to errorDuration, but in timecode format (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcScte35WindowEnd.description: Equivalent to scte35WindowEnd, but in timecode format (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcScte35WindowStart.description: Equivalent to scte35WindowStart, but in timecode format (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcSom.description: Equivalent to som, but in timecode format (hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

tcStartTime.description: Equivalent to startTime, but in timecode format (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss[:;]ff)

upid.description: The uPid value is inserted in the segmentation_upid field of the segmentation descriptor in generated SCTE-35 messages. SCTE-35 messages are generated for events with material type PROGRAM, AVAIL, or COMMERCIAL. It is a hexadecimal string, e.g. "0x000000002C11422B" with or without the leading "0x"

upidType.description: The uPid type is inserted in the segmentation_upid_type field of the segmentation descriptor in generated SCTE-35 messages. SCTE-35 messages are generated for events with material type PROGRAM, AVAIL, or COMMERCIAL

waitingForPlayEvent.description: True if the event requires a Play Next command (MANUAL start mode) or SCTE-35 trigger (EXTERNAL start mode) to start

audioPidOffset.description: Offset value for audio pid remapping, auto increment for multiple audio streams

basePid.description: Base value for pid remapping, outputPid will be basePid plus offset

otherPidOffset.description: Offset value for data stream pid remapping, auto increment for multiple data streams

videoPidOffset.description: Offset value for video pid remapping

ipAddress.description: IP address to send the output

ipPort.description: IP port to send the output

labels.description: Labels attached to IP output for identification

muteAtStartup.description: Disable the output (dedicated to the IP output of a mux)

aacComprTargetRefLevel.description: [-31 to -1] Compr Target Reference Level (ETSI metadata)

aacDrcTargetRefLevel.description: [-31 to -1] DRC Target Reference Level (MPEG metadata)

fallbackAacComprTargetRefLevel.description: [-31 to -1] Fallback Compr Target Reference Level (ETSI metadata)

fallbackAacDrcTargetRefLevel.description: [-31 to -1] Fallback DRC Target Reference Level (MPEG metadata)

fallbackAacProgramReferenceLevel.description: [-31 to -1] Fallback program reference level (MPEG metadata)

onlineServiceLimit.description: The maximum limit of total online service

totalServiceLimit.description: The maximum limit of total service

verticalOffset.description: Vertical offset (in pixels) applied to the DVB-Subtitles position, to the top of the screen. default: 0. range 0-1080. 0 means the DVB-Subtitles position is not modified. If the offset is too high, the DVB-Subtitles are displayed at the top of the screen.

nbIdrPerSequence.description: Irdeto watermark number of IDR frames per sequence

scdfactor.description: Irdeto watermark factor parameter for the scene-cut detection

graphicsTemplateId.description: Id of a graphic template in the system

rssUrl.description: Template Parameter used in a graphics template

lcevcScalingMode.description: Specifies the scaling mode for the base encoder picture in the LCEVC hierarchy

lcevcTune.description: Specifies the targeted quality metric for the LCEVC layer

endTime.description: Mute operation end time in UTC

startTime.description: Mute operation start time in UTC

languageIndex.description: Audio index used to mapping the languages defined in Configure app's setting, support up to 16 audio tracks, range 1~16

nielsenWatermarkProperties.description: Nielsen Watermark Properties used to override the deprecated values found in the profile

sourceLabel.description: Label of the source stream to be processed

dvbType.description:
SDT service type, range 0..255. When null, deprecated parameter 'type' is used.
When both parameters are null, the service type from input SDT is used (pass-through mode).
If not defined in input stream, value 0 is used

excludePidList.description: List of PIDs to be excluded (UUID).

filteredPmtDescriptors.description: When a descriptor tag (in hexa) is present in this list, there will be no PMT descriptor with this tag in the output, unless added using addedPmtDescriptors.

nameCodingTable.description: The parameter is applicable when SDT is generated, and the parameter name is set in mux configuration. default is "00" (Latin)

providerCodingTable.description: The parameter is applicable when SDT is generated, and the parameter provider is set in mux configuration. default is "00" (Latin)

separatePcrPid.description: pcr not on elementary stream pid

automationStatus.description: ONAIR when the player is on-air, LOCKED when the player will be on-air within Live Source Lockout Time, DEFINED when the player will be on-air later, otherwise UNDEFINED. When ONAIR or LOCKED, the user cannot assign another source to this player.

serviceStatus.description: List all service status associated to this channel

userStatus.description: DEFINED when the operator has assigned this source to this player. Note: the player may be preempted by the automation if another source will be on-air within Live Source Lockout Time.

id.description: Id

injectedId.description: Injected Id. Used to decrypt the SW when mode is BISS2 mode E. 32 hexadecimal characters long. If null, the global injected Id is used. On PUT, special value "******" means the value is not modified. GET will return this same special value.

swEven.description: Session word used to descramble TS packets with transport_scrambling_control set to 10. Clear if mode is BISS2 mode 1, encrypted if mode is BISS2 mode E. 32 hexadecimal characters long. On PUT, special value "******" means the value is not modified. GET will return this same special value.

swOdd.description: Session word used to descramble TS packets with transport_scrambling_control set to 11. Clear if mode is BISS2 mode 1, encrypted if mode is BISS2 mode E. 32 hexadecimal characters long. On PUT, special value "******" means the value is not modified. GET will return this same special value.

som.description: Indicates the position in the asset to start playback (hh:mm:ss.sss). When the SomType is RELATIVE, the SOM value is the offset from the start of asset. When the SomType is ABSOLUTE, it is the timecode value for the starting position in the asset. An empty or blank value is treated as zero offset

somType.description: The type of SOM, which determines how the SOM value is used. When the SomType is RELATIVE, the SOM value is the offset from the start of asset. When the SomType is ABSOLUTE, the Som value is the timecode value for the starting position in the asset

SCTE-35 messages are generated for events with material type PROGRAM, AVAIL, or COMMERCIAL. It is a hexadecimal string, e.g. "0x000000002C11422B" with or without the leading "0x"

upidType.description: The uPid type is inserted in the segmentation_upid_type field of the segmentation descriptor in generated SCTE-35 messages. SCTE-35 messages are generated for events with material type PROGRAM, AVAIL, or COMMERCIAL

aspect_ratio.description:
Any non-zero integer or N:M where N and M are non-zero integers
'source' - copy from source aspect ratio
'original' - keep original aspect ratio

bitrate.description:
Video bit rate
All: N (where N is any non zero integer of Kbps)

Interlaced encoding type. Only works with MPEG-TS
mpegts: tff, bff, no
mxf: tff, bff, source, no
mov_prores: tff, bff, source, no

framerate.description:
Any non-zero integer or N/M where N and M are non-zero integers
'copy' - take source's framerate

Video Horizontal Resolution
All: WxH, where W and N are any even integers.
3gp (h263): 128x96, 176x144, 352x288, 704x576, 1408x1152
zune: 320x180, 320x240
mxf: 720x480, 960x720, 1280x720, 1280x1080, 1440x1080, 1920x1080
Custom: To match your source aspect ratio, set X value to zero and Y value to your desired height. For example, 0x360 or 0x480.

idr_period.description: IDR period: N (where N is integer >=1 and <= 15)

profile.description:
The standard defines various sets of capabilities, which are referred to as profiles, targeting specific classes of applications
high, main, baseline
mov_prores: hq, std, lt, proxy

two_pass_decoding.description: Decode to a lossless format prior to encoding to reduce errors

vertical_resolution.description:
Video Vertical Resolution
All: WxH, where W and N are any even integers.
3gp (h263): 128x96, 176x144, 352x288, 704x576, 1408x1152
zune: 320x180, 320x240
mxf: 720x480, 960x720, 1280x720, 1280x1080, 1440x1080, 1920x1080
Custom: To match your source aspect ratio, set X value to zero and Y value to your desired height. For example, 0x360 or 0x480.

video_codec.description:
flv: flv, libx264, copy

wmv, zune: wmv2, msmpeg4, copy

fmp4_hls: libx264, hevc
advanced_hls: libx264

advanced_dash: libx264, libvpx-vp9, hevc

ogg: libtheora, copy
webm: libvpx, libvpx-vp9, copy
mp3, wma: none
mpeg2: mpeg2video, copy
mpeg1: mpeg1video, copy

mpegts: libx264, mpeg2video
mxf: dvcpro, dvcpro50, dvcprohd, xdcamhd422, imx30, copy
